checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes:
The UniProt Knowledgebase consists of two sections: a section containing manually-annotated records with information extracted from literature and curator-evaluated computational analysis (UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot), and a section with computationally analyzed records that await full manual annotation (UniProtKB/TrEMBL).
low risk - skipping inspection

    Access Method: download via website
    Provenance:

            European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI)

            Swiss Institute of Bioinformatics (SIB)

            Protein Information Resource (PIR)

UniProt applies CC BY 4.0 to copyrightable parts of its databases (which covers UniParc as a UniProt component).

observations:
No explicit, named AI models are specified as being used or adopted in a way that allows direct identification and download. 
The proposal consistently describes the approach as “a transformer model using PyTorch” without naming a concrete pretrained model, checkpoint, or architecture variant 

Models such as ProTrek and FGeneBERT are mentioned only as state-of-the-art examples in the literature review, not as models that will be used, fine-tuned, or downloaded for this project

The use of very old versions of some software packages.
recommendation: Conditional to providing the models and checks applied to them, the recommendation is to approval the proposal for grand challenge.
